publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-650 George Lyon: National Park Status For Argyll Forest Park—That the Parliament supports the inclusion of Argyll Forest Park within the boundaries of the first new National Park in Scotland (Loch Lomond and Trossachs); notes the real benefits that will flow to the Cowal economy from increased tourism and leisure and, most importantly, recognises the huge impact the National Park would have in rebranding the Cowal peninsula for the 21st century.

S1M-650 George Lyon: National Park Status For Argyll Forest Park—That the Parliament supports the inclusion of Argyll Forest Park within the boundaries of the first new National Park in Scotland (Loch Lomond and Trossachs); notes the real benefits that will flow to the Cowal economy from increased tourism and leisure and, most importantly, recognises the huge impact the National Park would have in rebranding the Cowal peninsula for the 21st century. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-650 National Park Status For Argyll Forest Park (lodged on 8 March 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-650 National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park (lodged on 8 March 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-650 National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park (lodged on 8 March 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-650# George Lyon: National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park—That the Parliament supports the inclusion of Argyll Forest Park within the boundaries of the first new National Park in Scotland (Loch Lomond and Trossachs); notes the real benefits that will flow to the Cowal economy from increased tourism and leisure and, most importantly, recognises the huge impact the National Park would have in rebranding the Cowal peninsula for the 21st century. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Ian Jenkins, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-650# National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park (lodged on 8 March 2000) Michael Russell*
S1M-650# National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park (lodged on 8 March 2000) Rhoda Grant*, Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-650# George Lyon: National Park Status for Argyll Forest Park—That the Parliament supports the inclusion of Argyll Forest Park within the boundaries of the first new National Park in Scotland (Loch Lomond and Trossachs); notes the real benefits that will flow to the Cowal economy from increased tourism and leisure and, most importantly, recognises the huge impact the National Park would have in rebranding the Cowal peninsula for the 21st century. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Ian Jenkins, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Michael Russell, Rhoda Grant, Maureen Macmillan
